channel.title: Talks By James E. Faust
channel.description: General Conference talks by James E. Faust.

image.title: General Conference talks by James E. Faust.

item.title: To Become One of the Fishers
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters and friends: It has been a sublime and moving experience to participate in sustaining President Lee and his counselors yesterday morning as the new First Presidency of the Church, and I humbly entreat the same spirit t

item.title: Reaching the One
item.description: My beloved brethren, I am humbled and honored by the transcending privilege of being able to speak to you in this great assemblage of the priesthood.

item.title: Happiness Is Having a Father Who Cares
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters and friends: Because of a great desire to be understood, I have humbly prayed for the Spirit of the Lord, and I also earnestly seek your sustaining spirit in what I have to say.

item.title: A New Aristocracy
item.description: It has recently been my privilege, along with the other General Authorities assigned to attend the great area conference in Stockholm, to travel to a limited extent in the great Scandinavian countries and on other assignments in England.

item.title: The Sanctity of Life
item.description: I most earnestly and humbly seek to be sustained and understood by the Spirit as I endeavor to discuss an important and sensitive subject. I approach it with all the humility and with the profound respect it commands.

item.title: The Keys of the Kingdom
item.description: On a quiet morning last week I left my office in Sao Paulo, Brazil, and walked over to the Sao Paulo Temple site. There was a soft morning mist beginning to clear away. As I walked up the gentle rise in the street onto the site, I noted with great in

item.title: A Personal Relationship with the Savior
item.description: I join with all in acknowledging the greatness of President S. Dilworth Young and his associates of the First Council of the Seventy. I am humbled and honored to be invited to serve in that council and in the First Quorum as well.

item.title: The Enriching of Marriage
item.description: Some years ago, I was consulted by a woman who desired a divorce from her husband on grounds which, in my opinion, were justified. After the divorce was concluded, I did not see her again for many years. A chance meeting with her on the street was ve

item.title: Response to the Call
item.description: President Kimball and my beloved brothers and sisters, no one has ever come to this calling with a greater sense of inadequacy than I do at this time. In the sweet agony of the pondering, in the long hours of the days and the nights since last Thursd

item.title: The Refiner’s Fire
item.description: Coming to this pulpit is always a very humbling responsibility. I seek the guidance of the Holy Spirit and pray that what I have to say will be guided by the Spirit and that it may abundantly rest upon all of us so that you might understand also by t

item.title: Establishing the Church: Welfare Services Missionaries Are an Important Resource
item.description: The Psalmist asked the question, “How shall we sing the Lord’s song in a strange land?” (). In every age, including our own, the Lord’s message has been brought into lands that were strange to the messengers. They have sought to establish a Zion wher

item.title: Communion with the Holy Spirit
item.description: At the Samoa area conference in 1976, President Spencer W. Kimball said: “Often when we have press conferences, the press asks us this question: ‘What is the greatest problem that your … Church has today?’ We answer that it is rapid growth. It is ver

item.title: These I Will Make My Leaders
item.description: I am humbled by the opportunity to address the priesthood this evening. I should like to direct my remarks to the leaders of the Church, and especially to the future leaders, the young men of the Aaronic Priesthood. Many of you young men will have le

item.title: The Dignity of Self
item.description: “We thank thee, O God, for a prophet to guide us in these latter days.”

item.title: The Expanding Inheritance from Joseph Smith
item.description: It was Friday morning, June 28, 1844, and already the summer sun was hot in Illinois. Since about eight o’clock that morning Dr. Willard Richards, Samuel H. Smith, and nine others had plodded along the dusty road between Carthage and Nauvoo, Illinois

item.title: Integrity, the Mother of Many Virtues
item.description: I should like to emphasize today three important elements of integrity—dealing justly with oneself, dealing justly with others, and recognizing the law of the harvest. I apologize for my directness. I do not wish to offend. I wish only to be understo

item.title: The Blessings We Receive As We Meet the Challenges of Economic Stress
item.description: Some years ago Bishop James T. Erekson, a wise and successful member of a high council I was involved with, made a statement which impressed me greatly. He said, “There are many in our generation who have not known the blessings of economic adversity

item.title: Enriching Family Life
item.description: Brethren, I come humbly to this pulpit. As a young man I recall President J. Reuben Clark pleading time after time in general priesthood meetings that there be unity in the priesthood. He would quote frequently the message of the Lord, “I say unto yo

item.title: The Keystone of Our Religion
item.description: Some time ago I held in my hand my mother’s copy of her favorite book. It was a timeworn copy of the Book of Mormon. Almost every page was marked; in spite of tender handling, some of the leaves were dog-eared, and the cover was worn thin. No one had

item.title: The Magnificent Vision Near Palmyra
item.description: I welcome all of the new General Authorities. I rejoice in the calls of Elder Oaks and Elder Nelson to the Council of Twelve Apostles. Brother Nelson has touched my heart deeper than any other man. He has held my heart in his hands and has cut into i

item.title: The Works of God
item.description: With a prayer in my heart for understanding, and with some timidity, I speak today concerning parents and children with special problems. I do so because I am persuaded that these extraordinary challenges are, as the Savior himself said, that “the wo

item.title: The Resurrection
item.description: In World War II, I was in a military hospital in Africa for a few days with a respiratory infection. The hospital was staffed with native orderlies who were to keep the hospital clean, change the beds, and generally be of help to the patients. Becaus

item.title: The Abundant Life
item.description: My message this morning concerns the search for the abundant life. Without wishing to give any offense, I would sincerely like to try and relate this search to everyone, including those Church members and others who consider themselves to be “loving

item.title: The Responsibility for Welfare Rests with Me and My Family
item.description: I wish to speak of the basic principles that keep our feet on the ground economically. This is important to our happiness. Let us examine ourselves and, like pilots in the sky, take our bearings to see if we are on course financially. We must build u

item.title: Unwanted Messages
item.description: I humbly and prayerfully hope that what I have to say will be received in the spirit that I would like to convey. We have just heard the prophet of God. He is a watchman on the tower. He has raised a warning voice. I would urge all to listen and foll

item.title: “Will I Be Happy?”
item.description: As we come to the closing minutes of this great conference, our souls are subdued and lifted by the inspiring messages of counsel and hope we have heard. I come prayerfully to this pulpit—not to judge, but to teach and to caution.

item.title: “The Great Imitator”
item.description: You may have heard the story, and it is a story, of the disruptive, noisy boys in a Sunday School class who were asked by their exasperated teacher why they bothered to attend Sunday School. One of the more impudent boys replied, “We came to see you

item.title: The Highest Place of Honor
item.description: It is an awesome and humbling responsibility to address the priesthood of the Church. I feel impressed, brethren, to speak to the men and the boys who hold the priesthood of Almighty God concerning our responsibility to the faithful sisters of the Ch

item.title: The Supernal Gift of the Atonement
item.description: My dear brothers, sisters and friends, sixteen years ago I was called to be a General Authority of this Church, and ten years ago this conference I was sustained as a member of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles. These years have been challenging and,

item.title: The Gift of the Holy Ghost—A Sure Compass
item.description: I rejoice in the historic action taken at this session of conference, and with all my heart I welcome the new Seventies into the brotherhood of the General Authorities.

item.title: Continuous Revelation
item.description: I wish to speak today of a special dimension of the gospel: the necessity for constant communication with God through the process known as divine revelation. This principle is basic to our belief. President Wilford Woodruff declared: “Whenever the Lo

item.title: Gratitude As a Saving Principle
item.description: In the closing moments of this conference, I come to this pulpit to speak about gratitude as an expression of faith and as a saving principle. The Lord has said, “And in nothing doth man offend God, or against none is his wrath kindled, save those wh

item.title: The Greatest Challenge in the World—Good Parenting
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters and friends, I ask for your faith and prayers this afternoon as I feel moved upon to discuss a subject which I have chosen to call the greatest challenge in the world. It has to do with the privilege and responsibility

item.title: A Crown of Thorns, a Crown of Glory
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters and friends, today I wish to speak of thorns, briars, slivers, and a crown of thorns. I also wish to speak of the exquisite beauty and fragrance to be found in life, and of a crown of glory. I wish that I better unders

item.title: The Lord’s Day
item.description: My brothers and sisters and friends, for some time I have pondered what I might speak about today. I seem to have been led in my thinking by a concern that so many in our generation are missing great blessings by not honoring the Lord’s day.

item.title: Spiritual Healing
item.description: I humbly come to this pulpit today to speak about a sure cure for heartache, disappointment, torment, anguish, and despair. The psalmist stated, “He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.” (.) The healing is a divine miracle; the w

item.title: A Priceless Heritage
item.description: As this conference comes to a close, I wish to speak of a priceless heritage. I acknowledge the faithful pioneers in all of the countries of the world who have helped establish the Church in their lands. First-generation members of the Church are ind

item.title: Father, Come Home
item.description: At this Easter season, I extend to all who are participating in these services my warmest greetings and prayers for your happiness and well-being. On this day we remember that the risen Lord has charged us with the responsibility to build the kingdom

item.title: Keeping Covenants and Honoring the Priesthood
item.description: Brethren, I have never come before this great body of the priesthood with greater humility than I do this evening. I fervently pray, not only for understanding, but also that I might not be misunderstood. I earnestly seek the support of the Holy Spir

item.title: Five Loaves and Two Fishes
item.description: I come before you, my brothers, sisters, and friends, with the sincere hope that you will extend to me your faith and prayers as I humbly seek in the next few minutes to acknowledge the hand of the Lord our God in our lives. I extend to Sister Norma

item.title: The Keys That Never Rust
item.description: A few months ago, my beloved Ruth, Elder Holland and his sweet Patty, and I accompanied a group into the fascinating old city of Jerusalem to look for the door with the name of Hyde carved on it. The enchanting smells of the open containers of spices

item.title: Responsibilities of Shepherds
item.description: My beloved brethren of the priesthood, it is very humbling to feel the great strength gathered here and in the many buildings across the world. As we gather tonight, we praise the name of President Howard W. Hunter for his life and his ministry, and

item.title: Heirs to the Kingdom of God
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters and friends, in responding at this pulpit as the newest member of the First Presidency of this church, I recall the words of Solomon, who said, “I am but a little child: I know not how to go out or come in.” Like Solom

item.title: Acting for Ourselves and Not Being Acted Upon
item.description: It is always a sacred responsibility to address the great body of the priesthood of this church. This evening I wish to speak primarily to the splendid young men of the Aaronic Priesthood. I do so because I recognize that the future of the Church and

item.title: Priesthood Blessings
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters and friends, I wish to affirm my love and appreciation to you for your faithfulness and devotion. I earnestly entreat your faith and prayers as I address a most important and holy subject: the divine, magnifying, and s

item.title: The Prophetic Voice
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters and friends, as we begin this historic conference, I am confident that we will hear the word of the Lord during all of the proceedings. The divine guidance which has directed the affairs of this Church for over 166 years

item.title: What I Want My Son to Know before He Leaves on His Mission
item.description: My beloved brethren, the responsibility of speaking to the priesthood of the Church is overwhelming. I feel honored to be numbered one of you. It is a great blessing to hold the priesthood of God. I earnestly seek your faith and prayers.

item.title: The Grand Key-Words for the Relief Society
item.description: My dear sisters, it is a humbling privilege to be with you tonight. We are especially honored with the presence of both President Hinckley and President Monson. I appreciate the sweet prayer of Sister Silver and the music of this extraordinary choir.

item.title: Honesty—a Moral Compass
item.description: My dear brethren, we are all privileged that so many of us in so many countries can be together in this great meeting of the priesthood of the Church. All of us are grateful that our beloved prophet and leader, President Gordon B. Hinckley, is presen

item.title: “Woman, Why Weepest Thou?”
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters and friends, the responsibility of speaking to you today prompts me to earnestly ask for your faith and prayers. Today I speak to those who have heartrending challenges. I speak to those who suffer, to those who mourn and

item.title: Eternity Lies before Us
item.description: Maintaining our spiritual strength is … a daily challenge. The greatest source of that spiritual strength comes … from our temples.

item.title: Power of the Priesthood
item.description: Caring for others is the very essence of priesthood responsibility. It is the power to bless, to heal, and to administer the saving ordinances of the gospel.

item.title: Pioneers of the Future: “Be Not Afraid, Only Believe”
item.description: We belong to the greatest cause on earth. We are the pioneers of the future. Let us go forth like the armies of Helaman and build the kingdom of God.

item.title: The Weightier Matters of the Law: Judgment, Mercy, and Faith
item.description: We are to focus on the inward things of the heart, which we know and value intuitively but often neglect for that which is trivial, superficial, or prideful.

item.title: How Near to the Angels
item.description: You will become great women if you are united in the angelic cause of doing good and if you hunger and thirst after righteousness.

item.title: “Search Me, O God, and Know My Heart”
item.description: Ordinances and covenants … are the vehicles the Lord has provided to conduct us into eternal life.

item.title: “We Seek After These Things”
item.description: We hope you are men who are “true at all times in whatsoever thing [you are] entrusted.” [Alma 53:20] … I plead for greater consistency between our beliefs and actions.

item.title: “By What Power … Have Ye Done This?”
item.description: The priesthood of God has become the eminent power for good in the world. … This great power … has been entrusted to us; we must not weaken it by failing in our responsibilities.

item.title: Opening the Windows of Heaven
item.description: Tithing is a principle that is fundamental to the personal happiness and well-being of the Church members worldwide, both rich and poor.

item.title: This Is Our Day
item.description: The marvels of modern science and technology will not exalt us. Indeed, the great challenge we face as we prepare for the future is to be more spiritually enlightened.

item.title: Obedience: The Path to Freedom
item.description: Obedience leads to true freedom. The more we obey revealed truth, the more we become liberated.

item.title: What It Means to Be a Daughter of God
item.description: The commitment and dedication of the sisters of this Church have been since the beginning a marvelous, strengthening ingredient.

item.title: Of Seeds and Soils
item.description: We particularly want you young men to have a strong testimony, with solid roots, because only then will it be an unerring compass for you.

item.title: Hope, an Anchor of the Soul
item.description: Our greatest hope comes from the knowledge that the Savior broke the bands of death. … He atoned for our sins if we repent.

item.title: Womanhood: The Highest Place of Honor
item.description: I promise you dear young sisters that if you live the standards of personal worthiness contained in the Young Women program, great will be your happiness and endless will be your joy.

item.title: The Shield of Faith
item.description: Never before in the history of the world has the need for faith in God been greater.

item.title: The Power of Self-Mastery
item.description: Self-mastery … is the ultimate test of our character.

item.title: The Enemy Within
item.description: Each of us needs to train ourselves to be bold, disciplined, and loyal men of the priesthood who are prepared with the proper weapons to fight against evil and to win.

item.title: A Growing Testimony
item.description: As I look back over my life, I recognize one source of singular strength and blessing. It is my testimony and knowledge that Jesus is the Christ.

item.title: “Them That Honour Me I Will Honour”
item.description: Honor four sacred principles in your lives: reverence for Deity; respecting and honoring family relationships; reverence for and obedience to the ordinances and covenants of the holy priesthood; respect for yourself as a son of God.

item.title: Born Again
item.description: The full benefit of forgiveness of sin through the Savior’s Atonement begins with repentance and baptism and then expands upon receiving the Holy Ghost.

item.title: The Atonement: Our Greatest Hope
item.description: Our salvation depends on believing in and accepting the Atonement. Such acceptance requires a continual effort to understand it more fully.

item.title: “Some Great Thing”
item.description: May we all be faithful in doing the day-to-day, ordinary things that prove our worthiness, for they will lead us to and qualify us for great things.

item.title: It Can’t Happen to Me
item.description: Your future may not hold fame or fortune, but it can be something far more lasting and fulfilling. Remember that what we do in life echoes in eternity.

item.title: The Lifeline of Prayer
item.description: Each of us has problems that we cannot solve and weaknesses that we cannot conquer without reaching out through prayer to a higher source of strength.

item.title: You Are All Heaven Sent
item.description: Your role as sisters is special and unique in the Lord’s work. You are the nurturers and the caregivers.

item.title: What’s in It for Me?
item.description: Taking up one’s cross and following the Savior means overcoming selfishness; it is a commitment to serve others.

item.title: I Believe I Can, I Knew I Could
item.description: While we are not all equal in experience, aptitude, and strength, … we will all be accountable for the use of the gifts and opportunities given to us.

item.title: The Virtues of Righteous Daughters of God
item.description: I encourage you to strengthen the virtues you have already acquired and resolve to develop many others.

item.title: The Devil’s Throat
item.description: Please help us push back the world. We must stand against the wind. Sometimes we must be unpopular and simply say, “This is not right.”

item.title: Dear Are the Sheep That Have Wandered
item.description: To those brokenhearted parents who have been righteous, diligent, and prayerful in the teaching of their disobedient children, we say to you, the Good Shepherd is watching over them.

item.title: Lord, I Believe; Help Thou Mine Unbelief
item.description: Sustaining faith can be the ultimate comfort in life. All of us must find our own testimonies.

item.title: The Phenomenon That Is You
item.description: Begin to unlock the knowledge of who you really are by learning more about your forebears.

item.title: Choices
item.description: Tomorrow’s blessings and opportunities depend on the choices we make today.

item.title: Did You Get the Right Message?
item.description: We should keep our lives in order so that when we receive a … message telling us what the Lord wants us to do we will be able to respond.

item.title: Where Do I Make My Stand?
item.description: To find happiness and joy, no matter what comes, we must make our stand unequivocally with the Lord.

item.title: The Key of the Knowledge of God
item.description: The key of the knowledge of God, administered by those who keep the oath and covenant of the Melchizedek Priesthood, will enable us to come off as the sons of God.

item.title: Perseverance
item.description: Perseverance is demonstrated by those who keep going when the going gets tough, who don’t give up even when others say, “It can’t be done.”

item.title: Standing in Holy Places
item.description: I encourage our Saints all over the world, wherever possible, to strive to stand more often in holy places.

item.title: Instruments in the Hands of God
item.description: Your influence for good is incalculable and indescribable.

item.title: The Light in Their Eyes
item.description: A sacred light comes to our eyes and countenances when we have a personal bond with our loving Heavenly Father and His Son.

item.title: Called and Chosen
item.description: Those called, sustained, and set apart are entitled to our sustaining support.

item.title: Your Light—a Standard to All Nations
item.description: I see the light shining in your faces. That light comes from the Lord, and as you radiate that light, it will bless you and many others.

item.title: A Royal Priesthood
item.description: While holding the priesthood brings great blessings, the priesthood also carries with it great obligations.

item.title: The Restoration of All Things
item.description: We believe The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints is a restoration of the original Church established by Jesus Christ.

item.title: Discipleship
item.description: One of the greatest blessings of life and eternity is to be counted as one of the devoted disciples of the Lord Jesus Christ.

item.title: Spiritual Nutrients
item.description: We need to increase our spiritual nutrients—nutrients that come from the knowledge of the fulness of the gospel and the powers of the holy priesthood.

item.title: Salt Lake Tabernacle Rededication
item.description: I am grateful this magnificent building has been strengthened and renewed so it can continue to be used to instruct and edify the children of God.

item.title: Message to My Grandsons
item.description: I hope each one of you becomes a man of God. You will become a man of God through righteous works.

item.title: The Healing Power of Forgiveness
item.description: If we can find forgiveness in our hearts for those who have caused us hurt and injury, we will rise to a higher level of self-esteem and well-being.
